titleStmt.title: Propositions 1. For recording and registering of deeds and conveyances. 2. Judgments, statutes, and other incumbrances upon lands and tenements. For prevention of frauds and deceits in sales; and quieting of possessions of purchasers. 3. For inabling creditors to have the benefit of copy-hold, and intayled lands and tenements for their satisfaction. As far as may be conveyed by surrender, or cut off by fine or common recovery; and of all chattals real, as well as personall. / By William Leach of the Middle-Temple, gent.
titleStmt.author: Leach, William.

titleStmt.title: Propositions 1. For recording and registering of deeds and conveyances. 2. Judgments, statutes, and other incumbrances upon lands and tenements. For prevention of frauds and deceits in sales; and quieting of possessions of purchasers. 3. For inabling creditors to have the benefit of copy-hold, and intayled lands and tenements for their satisfaction. As far as may be conveyed by surrender, or cut off by fine or common recovery; and of all chattals real, as well as personall. / By William Leach of the Middle-Temple, gent.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by W:H: and are to be sold by G:B: at his shop in Fleetstreet,

notesStmt.note: "For Recording .. Lands and Tenements." connected by right bracket to "For prevention .. Purchasers." on title page; "For inabling .. their satisfaction" connected by right bracket to "As far .. Personall.".
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
